text:
Aroma: sour cherry, red wine, raisins, vinegar, vanilla, barnyard, spicy
Taste: medium to heavy sour, moderate sweet, sour cherry, raisins, vinegar, red wine
Bottle sharing during Hevelka Fest, great composition of different aromas, funky, wild, cherries, vanilla and wood from bourbon barrel. Very good beer

@ArrogantSourFestival
Marrone molto scura, quasi nera con riflessi giallastri, schiuma color cappuccino di ottima persistenza.
Aroma di legno, cioccolato, ciliegia, acetico e vinoso.
Al palato, acetica, ciliegia, finale sempre acetico insieme a barrique, ciliegia, cantina e cioccolato fondente molto persistente insieme ad una nota vinosa.
Corpo pieno, non troppo carbonata.
Awesome beer. It is not very acidic but sour like a fruit. Great wine notes with a slight wine in the background. Worth its price and place.
Lekko octowe, lekka wanilia, przyjemnie kwaśne, nie czuć alko, wiśnie, klasa piwo.

Aromat to nuty winne, migdały, generalnie czerwone wino. Po pewnym czasie wychodzi jednak ogromna wanilia i kokos. W smaku na początku słodkie wiśnie i marcepan, później wchodzi bourbon w słodkiej postaci i cierpka wiśnia, a jeszcze później po gardle czule pieszcząc spływa bourbonowy alkohol. Genialne piwo, zdecydowanie wielowymiarowe. Z czerwonego wina przeistacza się w solidnego beczkowego bourbonowca.

From mobile notes; I thought I already drunk it from a bottle, but I was wrong. That was Framboise de amorosa...anyway, this one I drunk in BeerCraft Rohnert park@ a few days before RBB2017, where they had it on tap: poured dark reddish brown with practically no head, just beige brown ring around the glass edges. Aroma-flavors: tart cherries, funk, vanilla, woody oak notes, candy sugar, molasses, vanillin, very dry, tart finish. Alcohol is perfectly hidden. Body is medium?, texture soft, carbonation moderate to low.

Bottle, thnx to Jimmy. Pours a blurry caramel brownish beer without any head on top. Aroma of mostly chocolate and caramel, hint of oaky vanilla and a faint touch of Bretty notes. Flavor is quite tart, hints of caramel though, softly carbonated. Quite complex and interesting, full bodied and long lasting. Some boozy notes in the finish. Very nice.
Draft at The Confessional. Brownish/red. Raisins, oak, bourbon qualities, dark fruits, sour cherries, nice and tart. A very different take on the style. Lovely.

Draft at the brewery. Pours dark nut brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like tart fruits, red wine, nice acidity, earthy and woody malt. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like tart fruits, acidic, grassy malt, red wine, earth, and wood.

Tap at brewery. Pours hazy brown. Aroma is balsamic, oak, acetic acid, plums, raisins, cherries, and light toast. Flavor is very acidic with lots of dark fruit esters, oak, vanilla, and some caramel. Medium body.

Balsamvinäger-syrlig, romrussin, katrinplommon, vinös, aning ekfat och vaniljkola.
Mörkt brunrödaktig kulör, inget skum. 
Mjukt sötsyrlig smak med dragning åt körsbär, vin och många olika bär. Här finns en träaktig kärvhet som är lite otrevlig men i övrigt en mycket intressant, komplex komposition. 
Fyllig, alkoholstark och med en mycket låg kolsyrenivå. 
Eftersmaken är lång och syrlig.

From small bottle, vintage 2011 into small taster glass. No head, nose is vinegar, some cherries dark roasted wheat. Very sour, aged too long, very minimal carbonation, slight sweetness. Definitely past its prime, need to get hands on a bottle in its prime.

375ml bottle on a bottle share @Alebrowar Gdynia 
Perfect aroma of tart red fruit and red wina scents.  Looking a bit muddy and cherry in color.Taste is dominated by wine and fruitiness. Surprisingly drinkable, more like a very good wine than beer. Alcohol superbly hidden.
Shared bottle. Turbid ruby/brown pour, off-tan head, Nose was tart acidity, cherry, berry, oaky bourbon. Flavors of oak bourbon, cherry, tart finish. Great beer.
Flaska systembolaget. Brunröd vätska. Syrlig doft av jord, kärsbär, russin och lite knäck. Syrlig även i smaken med en mustig unkenhet. Jästa röda bär. Viss sötma med fat i eftersmaken

Aroma is vinegar, aceto balsamico, nutty, nutmeg, grapes, ethyl acetate, cherries and bourbon. Taste is more of the same, lovely Sour. Equal to Oerbier Reserva or Aardmonnik. Kudos Tomme!! Thanks for sharing berntholer!!

375ml bottle. Opaque, dark brown colour, no head. Spicy yeasty, vinous, fruity aroma, notes of morello cherry, blue grapes, raisin, hints of balsamico, a touch of oak and vanilla, raspberry flavoured dark chocolate. Taste is sour, vinous, tangy, fruity, notes of vinegar, morello cherry, blue grapes, plum, hints of raspberry, dry, oaky overtones; lasting, dry oaky finish, tart freshness compensates for flat carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Vestergaard, Lukasmh and Rasmusott. Thanks so much guys! Pours thick muddy reddish brown with a small fizzy white head. Aromas of dark fruits; raisins, prunes, dates. Sour cherries. Vanilla, fudge, oak, tannins, dark malt, caramel, filled chocolates, lactic, funk. Taste has sour cherries, sweet bourbon, tannins, vinous notes, red grapes, raisins, oak, lactic tartness, subtle barnyardy notes, dark malt, vinegary. Damn complex and delicious!

From notes. This was enjoyed at Jolly Pumpkin on October 1 for Zwanze Day 2016! The pour is a darker brown with hints of red shining through with a lighter khaki colored head that falls down slowly. The aroma on this is full of booze. Itll knock you back a step. The cherry comes through after that and a lot of roasted malt and a charred oak. The flavor offers the same surrender to the booze. The cherries and a damp barrel come through after that before there is a little roasted malt and a light tartness on the finish. Its interesting, but not terrible. The mouth feel is a little heavy, with a crisper carbonation and a lingeringly boozy cherry on the finish. The oak pokes back through has well. This is something else. Im not sure how I feel about it entirely, but I didnt pour it out.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Cuvee de Tomme (2012) by The Lost Abbey at PowiśleCzerwone wino. Ocet. Wisnie/czerwone porzeczki. Wytrawne. Drewniane. Troche taniczne. Super ukryty alko. Dlugie i fajne posmaki cytrynowe. fajnie zrownowazone. ale liczylem na wiecej ;)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Butelka z 2012. Aromat bardzo winny, gronowy, lekko z octem i beczką. Smak zadziwiająco zbalansowany, jest lekko kwaśno, dużo wytrawne, lekko słodkie w octowym stylu. W smaku to praktycznie wytrawne czerwone wino, dużo elementów gronowych, trochę wiśni, skórki cytryny, nuta kwaśnego jabłka. Posmak zadziwiająco krótki, wytrawny i lekko taniczny. Świetnie ukryte alko, a przecież to ma 11%. Bardzo dobre, lecz spodziewałem się wyrwania z butów. Jeśli ktoś lubi wytrawne wina i piwo, to jest temat dla niego.

Sample at Zwanze Day 2016 at Jolly Pumpkin. Aroma is booze, cherries, roast, woody, nice. Appearance is brown red, light brown head, mostly hazy. Taste is booze, wood, cherries, tart, roast, good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, woody booze cherries aftertaste. Overall, this is not as good as expected.
Brown cloudy appearance. Tart cherries, yeasty bready, light vinegar scent. Taste is sour with earthy quality. Fruits and yeasts come out next. Mouth is balanced. Tap.
Pours brown with a huge cherry aroma. Taste is strong sour cherry and tart finish. Im not a big sour liver but this is actually pretty good.

Mmm, smaken var otroligt intensiv, på gränsen till för mycket om man frågar mig. Smaken i sig bar kraftigt syrliga toner med mycket körsbär och syra. Kroppen var okej men balansen kunde jag inte känna av.
Amber color. Aromas of berries and dried fruits, raisins, figs and prunes. Heavily sour and tart taste, overshadows most other flavors. Some wood, sour finish.

Bottle from 2013 opened at Camping Kost-Ar-Moor. Very cloudy greenish brown, nearly opaque, no head. Sour wet grain, chocolate malts, balsamico vinegar, sour grapes, unripe and rotting fruit, apricots, plums, fruit stones, cherries, raisins, spices, oak, nuttiness, minerallike saltiness, bourbon, woodglue/rubberiness, bretty funk. Quite strong sour amidst fruity sweetness. Full body, low to no carbonation. Very rich and astringent. Strong sour liquid old floorboard.
2009 bottle thanks to Gibson. Pours a dark amber with no head. The roma is oak, leather, dark fruit. Medium body, strong oak, funk, light tart cherry, fruit has faded but still very good.

Deep brown/Amber with a thin beige head and light sticky lacing ..... Aroma of cherries, vanilla, dark fruits, Brett, chocolate malts and oak ... Complex and balanced aroma ..... Taste is of sour cherries, tart, Brett, vanilla, dry oak, raisins and chocolate malts .... Finished dry and sour with a lingering Brett, dry oak and cherry ..... Well balanced and the abv is non existent ..... Smooth and a little slick/oily

Wow. Very nicely executed in a style I love. Bigtime plum and apricot with some tangerine and pepper. Grapefruit bretta. Deep maroon pour with good head and lacing. Tangy finish with touch of grapefruit astringency. Tap at Sovereign Savor event.
On draft at Caliente. Poured deep mahogany with next to no head. Sour cherries, raisins, oak. Tart finish. Oily texture. Minimal warming alcohol present. As complex a sour as Ive had.

Bottle @ thx Thomas. Pours muddy brown with no head. Aroma of wood, cherry, bourbon, light vinegar, latic acidic, light raspberry, malty sweet, light brown.sugar, raisins, aicdic acid, very complex. Taste is very sour, alot of raisins, very complex, sour. Very oily.

Bottle courtesy of Gianluca at King Arthur pub in Ciampino-Rome. Pours clear reddish brown color, no head. Nose: chocolate, cherries, hush. Mouth: so rich, sick beer, aceto balsamico, cherries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep brown, with some brilliant reddish tinges. Almost no head, slight tan. Funky earthy nose, some light caramel, light roasted coffee bean. Fairly strong berry. Pretty strongly tart, underlying subtle back of the mouth sweetness. Heavier body, reasonably upfront alcohol, very oily, coats the palate. Long finish, tart. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy, reddish-brown with a smallish tan head and oily lace. Pleasant aromas of cherry, oak, vanilla, raisins, white wine grape and mild funk. Dark fruit sweetness up front becomes a mild tartness as cherries and blackberries mix with the oak and vanilla. Full body, little carbonation, slick mouthfeel and a lingering dark fruit sweetness in the finish.
A: Deep deep brown with red hint. No head. N: Cherry, poppy seeds T: Cherry, plum

Dark brown pour with red tinges and no head whatsover. Aroma of tart cherries, caramel, malts, vinegar and bourbon. Taste of tart cherries, caramel, vinegar, acidic, yeast, brett and slight oakiness. Full bodied, lower carbonation, tart finish.

Style et résumé: Classique sour red américaine avec raisins et cerises. 
Comment: EBF Boston 2016. 
Portrait: Un liquide brunâtre avec des reflets rouges. Un nez bien boisé avec des notes acides, vinaigrées avec une touche de chocolat. Une bouche acide avec des notes de cerises et de bois. Une finale bien vinaigrée dans le bons sens du terme. Un classique.
Note:  8/10

Bottle at De Koffer, Groningen. Complex aroma is malty, sour red fruits, tart cherries, oak, caramel, vinegar, raisins, funky yeast. Flavour is quite sour with a touch of malty sweetness. Body is medium. Wow, wonderfully complex and strong sour flavour. A great Belgian-style Sour Ale!

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2016 Bière rougêatre ou brunâtre, difficile à dire. Nez de chêne, de vinaigre bien fruité en repos sur une base maltée presque chocolatée. Sur les papilles, bonnes cerises aiguisées sur des céréales qui veulent arrondir. Touche épicée qui sapparente à la cannelle.  Bouche moyenne-mince avec pétillement très bas et texture vineuse. Finale fruitée acidulée assez poignante. Bonne!

Ruby dark red colour. No head at all. Cherries, oak, coffee beans, dark chocolate in the aroma. Very balanced and enjoyable smell. Cherriies and other berries at first. Dark chocolate, coffee in the middle. Sour, spicy finish. Rather medium bodied, very well balanced, exceptional beer with amazing palate. This is so good.

Pours dark brown but still brown, no head. Aroma has booze, sweet dark fruits. Plums and fig fruits. Taste has some intense vinegary sourness. Cherries and some smoky something. Dont know, just crazy beer. Woody barrel somewhere there too, raisins are probably to blame. Acidity is high, and flavours are full on. Aftertaste is nice lingering and long. I am also getting some tobacco or some reason. Bitterness there. Overall,yep, just crazy.

12.7oz corked bottle at home, opens without a sound. Very dark brown colour, cloudy, no head. Impressive nose big on tard, sour cherries and red wine; green apples, some distant malty, dried fruits and bourbon tones. Taste at first gets these fruity and really sour cherry tones, vinous, then mellows to the roasted malty, vanilla, cask and bourbon base ale. Very well balanced. Aftertaste lingers looooong, fruity, acidic, vinous; some tannine-dry, smoky bitter tones too. Very low carbonation, big body.

375ml bottle.
Opens without a sound, and pours a lovely deep tawny brown, with absolutely no head.
Complex, mature, sour, acetic aroma, wood, dark fruits, cherries, vanilla, caramel, raisin, chestnut, balsamic notes, prunes, leather.
Dry, medium to full bodied, low to mid bitterness, very low CO2.
The taste reflects the aroma very well. Complex, mature, with a clean acidity that lingers very long. Excellent balance, the only drawback is the acetic notes that are a bit too upfront. Otherwise, very, very good. (2016-01-17)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 8/27/2011. 
Deep murky reddish brown body. An aggressive pour yields a good size head.

Smell is mostly cherries. Some dark malts linger behind a strong acidity. Tart and a bit of funk to start. Behind the initial tartness is a nice vanilla and slight bourbon flavor. I probably only taste the bourbon since it said bourbon on the label, though. What I do like is how the tartness returns in the finish.

Well carbonated and pretty heavy.

Delicious beer. I would like more of the original quad to come through, but as a sour it is near perfection.
Pours an amber brown color with a khaki head. Raisin, molasses, oak, cherry, tart and chocolate aroma and flavors. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Tart, cherry and raisin finish.

Draft pour at Brouwers big wood festival. This is the 2011, Dark amber pour almost black pour, sweet aroma kind cherry sour, thick taste smooth and sour at the same time lot of cherry on the finish. Ive had this fresh and it is a lot more sour blends out over time. Awesome beer

Bottle shared at a tasting. Thanks Jon! Pours a dark brown with very little head. Dark fruit all over the nose with rum raisin cake and prune standing out. As it warms the bourbon jumps out and leaves some light oak and vanilla notes as well. Medium body with soft carbonation. Boozy with good tart cherry flavor moving toward the finish. Slightly boozy with an array of flavors that come and go and reappear throughout. Fantastic.
Bottle, thanks Jon. Lots of booze, lots of raisins, light fruitiness, bourbon. Full on in the mouth, fruit, Xmas cake. Lots of booze. Marzipan. Dark fruit.

Poured into a wine glass showing an opaque dark brown center with translucent rims. 

The nose is port wine-like;showing caramel and raisins. The bourbon comes forward and takes the center stage as the beer warms up, and a very slight cherry profile appears in the background. 

The palate is medium bodied with practically no carbonation. Moderate to high tartness, cherries start the flavors on the first impression but quickly evolves into a domination of bourbon flavors. On the finish and linger, the cherries and vanilla make another reappearance.

75cl bottle, tasting @ Chez Alain, Rennes. Hazy orange with a thin head. Jammed fruits, prunes, wood, funk, frangipane. Moderate sweet and sour. Not as complex as other sour ales but well rounded off.
2009. Cherry smell. Incredibly nice sour cherry taste with a touch of malt. Pretty delicious. Medium body, very low carbonation, and no foam.

Draft. Mostly clear garnet pour with a lasting beige head and excellent lacing. Big tart cherry aroma, leather, vinegar, funk. The flavor is big and deep. Cherry as hell, tart and funky. Fairly full body, well carbonated - a first for Flat Abbey. Very legit.Earlier Rating: 5/25/2009 Total Score: 4.1Bottle, labeled as Lost Abbey (not Pizza Port) Cuvee de Tomme.  Excellent dark reddish-brown color with a tan head.  Aroma of dark fruits, oak, and tartness.  Flavor is complex with sour cherries, figs, raisins, vanilla, oak, and sourness that isnt too intense.  Mild sweetness present as well to balance.  Sharp palate with medium carbonation and fairly full body.  Good stuff.

(375ml 2012 bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Sept 4 2015) Very dark reddish brown with no head. Aroma quite fruity, sour cherry, raisin, prune, oxidized, port, wood, caramel, vanilla hints, light balsamic vinegar, lovely depth and sweetness/acidity balance. Flavour is concentrated and lightly to moderately sour and oxidized. There is caramel, lots of sour cherries, wood, Madiera, prune and raisin building from the middle on. Finish and aftertaste is long and intense with balsamico, sour cherry, raisin and prune touches, wood, vaguest alcoholic bourbon hint. Medium bodied and basically flat by this age, and hides the ABV very well. Very good flavour intensity overall, well-balanced, a bare hint of carb might have been nice. Tasted a Liefmans Goudenband alongside and it was like water in comparison. Will need to have a younger one sometime to compare.

2013 bottle. Murky brown red color with a few bubbles on top. Awesome aroma of raisins, vanilla, plums, dried dates, lactic sourness, tart cherries, oak, bourbon. Taste is very tart and vinous, red berries, cherries, vanilla, oak, bourbon, bit of lemon. Very dry finish with a long aftertaste of dried fruit and vanilla. Beautiful beer!

Honestly said a bit disappointing. Not bad at all but I had way higher expecetations which that beer could not match . Really sour but in a acid way with only some berries in the back. No hint of ceomplexity or any barrels. Nice and refreshing but only acidity in the end.

Bottle, 2008 vintage, from fonefan, many thanks, Jan. The beer has got a hazy brownish colour with a small head and medium body. Aroma of acid, unripe fruits and oak. Taste is little bit on the thin side, expected more. Sour cherries, cherry kernels, seeds, mild barley, mild malt, bread, oak, dust. Sourness is mild, texture quite thin.

201? bottle opened tonight (neck is marked JINTP). Clear, mahogany pour with no head or even bubbles. Even with a hard pour, the beer is still. Modest sediment in the bottom and side, fairly compacted - bottle was stored on its side for a while, then upright for at least two years. Nose is raisins and cherries, with hints of bourbon. Medium body, no carbonation. Tart cherries, raisins, vanilla, bourbon, plums and almonds. No acetic character, though it is quite tart. Finish is long and followed by stomach warming and cherry stones. While quite good still, a small amount of carbonation would vastly increase my enjoyment of this beer.
Pours a dark brown without any head. Pretty still. Aromas of cherry dark fruits, light bourbon. Taste is sour with a light sweetness in the middle and tart at the end. The mouth feel is quite thick.
Botlle shared thanks to Art. Poured very dark brown no head. Aroma sweet funky tart cherry barrel. Light carb med bod. Tastes sour mega fruit.

2013 vintage. Shy head that vanishes quickly. Nose: cherries, vanilla, sweet melon, wine, oak, banana, lacquered dark wood, cigarette smoke, almonds. Aroma alone makes this beer exceptional, really enjoying it. Taste: surprisingly sour, cherries, raisins, coffee notes, a bit disappointing compared with the aroma. Full, creamy body; almost zero carbonation. Long, dry, slightly astringent finish that gives way to some fruity sweetness after a while. Watermelon notes. I expected this beer to be sweeter and similar to Rochefort 10, but in fact it reminds me more of Cuvée des Jacobins. A stronger, sweeter, even a bit cloying at times, version of Cuvée des Jacobins, actually. This beer feels a bit "overengineered"; has a bit too much of everything in it; in particular it feels like it cant decide whether it wants to be a quadruple or a sour. Still quite pleasant, though.

(Thanks Stefan, "StefanSD")

Bottle.

A- Cherries, tart, vanilla, grapes, red wine, subtle oak, subtle bourbon.

A- Dark mahogany color, dark liquid, no head.

T- Dark cherries, tart, sour, subtle vanilla, bourbon.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, tart finish.

O- I expected great things here. Not that I was let down or anything, but kind of. Lots of tart sour cherry and then bourbon on the finish. I loved the description but the taste to me just didnt live up. With all due respect, Im sure this is a hot beer for some but it just left me in meh mode.

Muddy red brown color without foam. The smell is light sourish and very round. Sour, thick bread taste (reminds me of the rodenbach grand cru) with fruity apple. The aftertaste is dry and (brown) sour.

Red in colour, almost no head. Aroma of wine, red fruits, vanilla - very sweet and intense with low level of tart notes and funkiness in the back. In taste sourness mixed with tart and sweet fruits, wine and woody notes. Full bodied, high carbonation, sweet, with alcohol still noticable. Too sweet, but OK.

Bottle at SinH4s Goodbye Event. Slightly odd aroma, but wow, what an intense and complex taste and finish! So many fruit and berry flavours, sweet and sour but not overpowered. A really exciting beer!

Hazy literal blood red color with no head. Fruity red wine aroma, so much fruits! a bit tart, hints of funk. Taste is first sourness, then the fruits from the nose, cherries, red wine, heavy, sweetish, sour finish. Wood. Some spices. Amazing! One more Lost Abbey that lives up to the reputation.

12.7 fluid oz bottle. Pours dark reddish brown in colour, no head to speak of and aroma of sour cherries, vineous, fruity & woody, with some light funk. Taste is sweet & sour, tart dark cherries, juicy, woody, some spice, with sherry-like notes. Slick mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, fairly clean finish. Very drinkable.

On tap at Pour House, believe this was aged.
Appearance: Murky chestnut/garnet body with a tan head.
Aroma: Green apple Jolly Rancher with sweet watermelon and tart cherry.
Taste: Big vinegar pucker by the finish, heart burn inducing.
Palate: Medium bodied, highly carbonated.
Overall: Aroma is awesome, flavor is one-dimensional. Too acedic finish.

Bottle (Vintage 2009) at Mikkeller Viktoriagade, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150503. Colour is deep dark ruby with very small bubbly white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, massive wood, oak, raisins, dryness and dry fruits.

Rating #5000!!!

Naturally, Ive been saving this bottle for a while, and I picked a pretty good time to crack it open! Super dark brown coloured body with a violet and light ruby glow, all with no head, no movement and no carbonation at all. Aroma of sour grapes, cherries, malt, yeast, brett, yeast, pit fruit sweetness, alcohol, vinegar and way more sour notes that are mouth-watering! Medium to Full-bodied; Rich malty flavour at first that shows a lot of sour notes at first then fades to a vinegar and almost rich prune and deep cherry flavour with a good deep malt flavour, some raisin and date sweetness and a complex alcohol flavour at the end, with more and even deeper complexity from the sour notes of grapes, cherries and apples. Aftertaste is nice and robust with malt at first, but all sour and complex fragrant flavours with cherries and grapes at first, but a rich prune and alcohol pit fruit flavour of sweetness comes through at the end, all still with some light chocolate maltiness. Overall, a very nice and rich beer that shows well throughout, leads a lot of complexity down the line, but still has a ton of sour flavours - all this without carbonation, as well. Definitely worth trying and keeping a few bottles of this, if you can find it - ill be looking for more of this to cellar on the West Coast. I sampled this caged and corked 37,5 split bottle purchased from Olive Tree Market Place in San Diego, California on 08-February-2011 for US$16,49 sampled at home in Washington on 10-May-2015 - Mothers Day 2015, a bit more than 4 years after purchase. Great to finally sample this one, but perfect as a celebratory rating!

375ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Dark mahogany color. No head, flat. Woody, whiskey, alcohol, prunes, sweet notes in aroma. Sour, licorice, woody, sweet, oak, apples in taste. Acidic mouthfeel. They have dissolved at least 3 lakupiipu in this bottle. Alcohol is well hidden behind all this vinegar and salt (so where are my chips?). Hurts my tongue a bit, but not bad. Not a fan of sours, but I can drink it.

On tap at the source. Pours light brown. Aroma is tart cherries and chocolate. Really super fantastic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle (Alus Celle, Riga)
Pleasant wqod-glue aromas, a little bit of vanilla, quite sour. Nice dark brown, but glassy - no head at all. Horrific vinegary acid palate. Some sugar sweetness. For looks, I have to add an extra point for the look in Areshs face as he takes a sip, its like a baby sucking on a slice of lemon, but followed by more swearing. Taste has burnt liquorish and rubber, some marmite yeastiness. Apparently whoever wrote the commercial description was unaware that brett doesnt cause battery acid, other little bugs do instead, brett causes funk. So one can only conclude that the brewers dont actually know about how to brew a beer. Ooops, Aresh drainpours his, so does Anna - Marduks up for more and volunteers. For me, this is a complete battery acid fuckup. I guess its an OK vinaigrette salad dressing. Aresh = 7:3:1:1:1=1.3 - "Im not prepared to call this beer, I dont drink apple vinegar".

Bottled; shared with Clayton and Martin at Claytons; 3rd May 2015.

Stunning oak chips and wood on aroma. Typically Rodenbach aroma. Taste is sour cherry, cherry tart; moderate puckering, light acid, great use of lactose. This is a fantastic example of beating the Belgians at their own game. Some vinegar and Modena oil too. Super.
On tap at Harrys Hofbrau. Aromas of tart cherry, slight earth. Pours an aged burgundy-brown with minimal white head. Taste is smooth tart cherry and moderate bread. Bone dry creates a quick finish.

Draught at hopping pig. Pours a deep cloudy reddish brown. Aroma of sour cherries, wood, raisin, bourbon. Taste is sweet and sour. Palate is sticky, astringent, leaving a slick refreshment and salivation for more.

Tap at Lord Hobo. Pours a nice dark brown/reddish with small beige rim that leaves good lacing. Nose is of grapes, red wine, cherries and some sugar. Taste is of grapes, vinous, not too acetic but with a nice Flanders Red character still. More red fruits. Moderately sweet and not too boozy for such a hefty brew. Body is medium-full, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel slightly syrupy. Overall it was every bit as good as I thought it would be. Nice!
Draft at TDAs 5th. Better or draft than the bottle Ive had, carb helps. Bourbon and sour cherries lead on the nose, tadte brings in the raisins. But and pleasantly tart. Some lingering funk, nice.

Very cloudy, light brown color. Modest head but plenty of spotty lace on the glass. The liquid is brown. 

Slightly sour with a bit raspberry and cherry to the nose. 

The flavor follows the smell. Not extreme like some. Theres an element of darker malts. I detect no bitterness. A mild sour.
Seemed bottle conditioned....slight cloudy brown, decent effervescence. Some wine and brandy notes really nice. Some leTher and funk oak too. Excellent beer.

Raisins plums prunes sour cherries all over the aroma and palate. Very tart and crisp with all kinds of delicious fruits! Nice white head and carbonation. Bottle was older so had time I guess to get the yeast working. Glad I waited.
Bottle. Dark red brown color. Almost no head. Medium high sour, light sweet, medium bitter. Spicy finish. Aroma is brett, banana, grapes, wood, barnyard, spices, cherries. Its very nice!
06 bottle. A nice tart and hoppy flavor. Deep strong sipper. Crispy apple flavor. Very smooth. Acidic and woody.
Tap. Pours dark hazy brown with tan head. Aroma is very prunes, raisins, chocolate. Taste is medium sour, good flavor, medium bodied, high carbonation. Overall, good.

12.7 fl oz bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours cloudy/murky brown with no head. Aroma is sour cherries, figs, dried dates, caramel and raisins. Flavour is sour! Medium bodied, sticky texture, no carbonation. Finish is long and very sour with dark fruits. Complex and enjoyable.

This is one of my favorite styles,Pours a muddy brown with no head or sign of carbonation. Aroma is sour cherries, caramel, raisins, a touch of funk, perfect balance of sweet and sour, very complex. Taste is cherry, chocolate, raisins, red currants. CHEERS!
Draft at the brewery a few weeks back while on a whirlwind tour of SD with t0rin0. Sour, bourbon, cherry. Very yummy.
Rich malty dried fruit aromas. Deep murky brown red. Rich with a tart overtones sour raisin. Leaves a nice roasted tart behind. Delicious.

Ruby colour, no head. Aroma of funk, vinegar, barnyard, cheese, cherries, oak. Taste is medium sour, bitter and dry aftertaste. Light to medium body, thin texture, soft to flat carbonation. By no means bad but I was expecting more

Taster at The Beer Store, SF. Pours mahogany with a light brown head. Nose is sour cherry, decaying leaves, oak, spice, grape skin, and port. Flavour is dark cherry, grape skin, sour apple, plum, oak, earth, Brett notes, and barnyard funk. This is an amazing sour ale.

Clear dark brown colour, dissipating white head. Aroma of cherry, caramel, raisins, mocha, light vanilla. Sweet flavour, light sour note, mocha, cherry, brown sugar, light bourbon. Sweet finish, raisins, amarena cherries, hint of nail polish.(from 375mL bottle @ home)

One of the flagships of Lost Abbey, a complex, Belgian-inspired ale (the term cuvée" already hints that) matured on wine and bourbon barrels, with added sour cherries and wild yeasts. Very thin and pale beige head, requiring some forcing to develop and breaking open in instants, eventually disappearing altogether; colour a very dark brownish purple, like an old port wine, hazy to cloudy, with pale protein flakes at the bottom after adding the deposit. Strong and expectedly very complex aroma of sour cherries, red wine vinegar, cranberries, vanilla, oaky tannins, hint of bourbon, caramel, dusty cellar, varnish but not disturbingly so, sour yoghurt, balsamic vinegar, raisins, figs in jenever, cardboard, tomato concentrate, almond. Complex estery fruitiness in the onset, sour cherries and berries, lemony acidity even drying the mouth, lactic acidity as well, balsamic vinegar, woody tannins coming up quickly over a smooth caramelly maltiness, somewhat dusty, with increasing drying tartness in the finish, as well as increasing woodiness and a hint of warming, port wine- and bourbon-like alcohol, very vinous, with some lingering malt sweetness, truly mouth watering. The sour, dry fruitiness and tannins remain in the mouth long after youve taken your last sip.  This is righteously a classic, a wonderfully complex, woody and fruity sour, which is clearly linked to the Flemish oud bruin tradition, but in a pimped kind of way. Noble, warming, vinous and extremely appetizing: a must if you are into sour beer types. This kind of gastronomic beers are on a par with any great wine, if you ask me.

Mörkt brun vätska. Stor och tydlig doft av röda bär och mörkt vattendränkt ek. Lätt syrlig smak med fatlagringston. Ett bra replikeringsförsök av det belgiska originalet men ändå långt ifrån.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 33cl bottle. Pours dark red brown with no head. Pediococcus, cherry, oak.. some co2. Taste is astringent sour cranberry with hints of dates, raisins, cherry, oak and vanilla aftertaste. Lovely burn on the palate, flavours linger on. Mmm cherry oak stamina cuvee, this Cuvee de Tomme.
On tap at the Red Hot. Hazy dark brown. THick tan head. Scent is a strong sour one. Taste is nice and sour. , raisin, vanilla. Super smooth. Super tasty.
On tap at a place in Santa Rosa. Nice brownish red pour. Nice flavor and aroma of sour cherries. Missed this guy being on tap at Lost Abbey a few years back. Glad to have gotten to finally try it.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, SF.
Red-brown, beige head. Cherry nose. Huge in flavour; tart, cherry, some malt, burnt sugar. Very layered. Great balance for a wild sour. Hides ABV well...
Lovely.
Very strong sour taste! Great wine aroma, flavor of ripe cherry, vanilla, barrel, astringent tartness

De color marrón oscuro con algún destello rojizo. Prácticamente sin espuma y por tanto sin carbonatación.
Aroma a tarta de cerezas y algo de vainilla. Más ligeramente barrica y levadura.
En boca aparece el ácido de la cerezas y cierto recuerdo a vino blanco.
El alcohol se nota en el estómago. Gran cerveza pero con un precio prohibitivo.

Draft at Beachwood BBQ in long beach. Aroma is sweet, candy sugar, berry goodness, light tartness. Flavor has a huge tartness to it, sour red character, slight boozy sweetness. Light to medium in body with a solid lingering berry tartness.
Tap at Harrys Hofbrau. Slightly reddish, deep brown color, very little foam. Not much aroma wise, faint sour cherry. Awesome flavor, sour cherry, woody barrel, and toastmaster are perfectly blended.

Look: Light pour with no head, carbonation isnt visible either. Darker brown with relatively strong red hue, like a deep red chocolaty wine. Bit of yeast lacing, lots of yeast floating on the bottom. 


Smell: Velvety white wine, lots of oak and vanilla combined with marvelously smooth funk. Highly complex, rich. Most dominant beside oak is the light sweetness with orange, red currant, the acetic acid is relatively low key but still the main driving force for welcomed freshness. 


Taste: Red currant, cherry start with soft fruity acidity and some surprising funk and pear. Continuous with light caramel, grain sweetness but is quickly consumed by medium acetic, vinous sour and velvet funk, oak. Funk and oak also come out at the far end, where they linger for a long time. 


Mouthfeel: Medium light heavy body, dry and no alcohol to detect.


Overall: The funk/oak dynamic is superb in this one. Its an expensive treat, but if your into unique and complex stories, do yourself a favor and grab one.
This is seriously on of the most unique teasing beers I've ever had. It starts with a sour flavor develops a smokey oak flavor and finishes strongly of raisins.

Bottle at Xmas, pours deep cherry red, small head and light carbonation. Cherries in the noise, with cocoa, oak, grape, sour, sour, sour, acidy tannins tingle on the tongue imparting a long full, heavy sour cherry aftertaste. Really well done with great balance.

Bottle thanks to..... eek Im really sorry, someone gave this to me at a Pigs Ear beer festival when it was still at the nightclub. And for that so much thanks. TBone? Ken? Sorry. Pours deep deep ruby almost black with ruby edges. Lasting tan head. Excellent exciting spine tingling sour cherry aroma, with some malt backbone. Like black cherry, some chocolate. Smells like a dark chocolate cherry liquer. The sour aroma is hypnotic. Its freakin excellent. OK so Id want a bit more farmyard from an authentic Belgian sour, but that is being picky. Smooth dark chocolate and this burst of sour dark cherry. Its really quite sour. Perfectly balanced though and quite dry on the finish, with a touch of fruity vinegar on the finish. A little bit of tannin. I mean it is superb. Complex flavours. Lacks perhaps the authentic Belgian funk but still, its pretty damn good. Smooth, sour. Some vinegar flavours that build. An accomplished sour. Its rather hypnotising. Ill have to have a Struise Earthmonk afterwards to compare. I liked it though.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Couleur sombre, reflets ambrés, mousse qui disparait. Super nez fruits rouges/cerise et bourbon (vanillé et boisé neuf), magnifique. Gout intense de cerises noires, fruits rouges aigres , on dirait une marmelade, avec fut de bourbon vanillé et chêne, note de malt doux, tannins et alcool. Un corps presque huileux bien rond en bouche. Une fin très longue en bouche cerise aigre et acidulée vient clore ce monument!

Bottle at Appellation Comely Bank tasting thanks to BenH.
Appearance - muddy brown like starting into a puddle. Also no head whatsoever.
Nose - incredible, so much going on. Sour, but salty almost like anchovies, then theres wood spice complementing the salt with pepper. A sweet tang from fruit going on too.
Taste - as per the nose, it drags you in and shows you more and more.
Palate - the body is medium in structure, the texture seems delicate to begin with but then it shows great power and persistence. The finish is a continuation of this and it tapers perfectly to the end. A beer of incredible elegance and restrained power. 
Overall - A beer of true individual personality and now my new favourite beer! Wow, thanks Ben, one Ill never forget.

Bottle at tasting. Shame we left this so late in to the night! Pours murky brown, no real head. Lovely aromas, leather, sour fruit, oak, spice, raisins, pepper. Lots going on. Taste is cherries, oak, bourbon, and everything else! Very sour finish. Different to everything on that night, and in a class of its own.
Bottle. Bit of an ugly brown with no head. Aroma is leathery and funky, raisin, prune, oak, spicy, peppery. Taste is intense, prune, hint of chocolate, super funky, spicy. Extremely sour

Bottle: 2006 vintage, around 8 years old. Reminds me I need to crack my fresh bottle soon. Huge thanks to Mike for this old beast. Muddy, red-brown swamp water. No head at all... Surprised? Looks like shit, to be honest. But the aroma is nice! Sour cherry, vinous red grape, booze-laden & drenched oak, earthy lemon, & hints of vanilla. Very mild on acetic & lactic notes. Taste is boozier than expected with a very slight bourbon tone that transitions more into a boozy wine-like feeling once the rest of the flavors kick in. Acidic cherry skin, red wine grapes, lemon. Oxidation is present, but gives off more of a boozy-sherry vibe at this point, thankfully. Lots of cherry & lots of wet oak in the finish. Leans towards darker fruits (prune, date, raisin) but the acidity & tartness keep things bright. Smooth, oily mouth feel; some carbonation would help a bit.

375cl bottle served in a Prearis glass (which incidentally is identical to a Lost Abbey glass). Pours a dark mahogany colour with zero carbonation and only with the final drips does a head form (for all of two seconds). Aroma is the most powerful rendition of the style I have experienced. Taste once up to temperature is complex treat of cherries, red wine, oak, and bourbon. Hides its ABV like no other beer and the mouthfeel is luxuriously apt. Very good but rather pricey compared to say a Liefmans Goudenband.

Niestety piwo nie dam rady wypić.

Lubię kwaśne piwa ale niektóre wywołujā po prostu ból brzucha.

Aromat piwa nie jest super intensywny ze względu na brak nasycenia i piany ale można wyczuć drewno, wiśnie, wanilie, przyprawy, rodzynki i tarte. W konsystencji przypomina czerwone wino.

W smaku przyprawowe o smaku tarty i suszonych owoców, przypraw i mnóstwo drewna. Do tego mega kwaśne ale na styl octu winnego. Do tego cierpkie jak pestki wiśni. Ogólnie dla tych wytrwałych o mocnym żołādku. Ja nie daje rady.

Alkohol świetnie schowany.

Jest to piwo, które osobiście bym blendował jak to robi się w gatunku Flanders Brown na przykład by smak był bardziej wyważony.

Jest moc.

May 4th, 2013 - Ratebeer says I havent, but Im sure Ive had the Cuvée de Tomme before. Why? My very first trip to the GABF (2007, I believe) I remember rushing over to Lost Abbey booth and waiting in line (all of three people) for a taste of the stuff. And Tomme Arthur himself was pouring. It was my first beer celebrity meeting, and is burnt into my memory like a brand into oak. But I neglected to write up a review in the aftermath. Maybe I wasnt ready to translate the experience into words, or maybe I just lost my notes. But I had a chance to re-taste the Cuvée here at Lost Abbeys anniversary party, because it was good, but also because it demands another review - a rare phenomenon in my beer drinking habits. The flavor this time around blends chocolate and sour, turning what would normally be discordant tastes into a gripping harmony. There is also cocoa dust, barrel aged sourness, and flower petals drifting here and there in a brew that is complex in a way I cant parse out after having already had three heavy-weight, beautiful beers. On the aftertaste I catch some ginger candy too, which wraps each sip up tidily like an ornate knot on the top of a furoshiki. The aroma reflects the flavor in depth, intensity and intensity, with the added touch of bubblegum dust (that powder on a slab of Bazooka Joe gum), easing the drinker in to the arcane and inspiring taste ahead.

Ölföreningen 2014. Smak och doft av körsbär, tranbär, russin, fikon portvin, ekfat, trä, torkad frukt, plommonkärnor med toner av äppelvinäger. Syrlig, frisk, lagom sötma. Tjock, rund och len. Välbalanserad med lite strävhet i beskan. Så mycket smak, bland det godaste jag smakat.

375 ml bottle from Beergium.com, 2013 edition.
Dark brownish red body, no head.
Aroma is sour, tart, with barrel notes, barnyard, cherry, dark berries, dried fruits, brown sugar, some vinegar.
Wonderful taste, full, satisfyingly tart and sour, but still comfortable, with quite similar aromas as in the nose, but with even more depth.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a low carbonation.
Finishes sour and with long-lasting wooden barrel notes.

Delicious! Feels more like a red wine than a beer, very complex, deep and luxurious. The balance is just oustanding! One of the very best sour beers Ive had so far, although Ive enjoyed the Rodenbach Caractère Rouge even a bit more.
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is oaky, vanilla, toffee, funky cherry, taste is hugely tart, cherry, woody, vanilla, dark fruit.

Bottle. Dark amber no head. Yeasty sour aroma with plenty of berries. Alcohol sweetness too. Rich mouthfeel moving to dry end. Good micro bubble zing. Taste is sour cherry, hint of bourbon. Some blackcurrant. Very well crafted - great balance. Up there with the Rodenbach Vintages, indeed maybe better as the BAing gives it a warmth and rounded finish. Top.

Dark brown, bit murky, with no head. Love aroma with notes of balsamic vinegar, sour cherries, black currants. The taste is sweet and sour with a slightly bitter finish. The flavour is dominated is fruity, almost sweets-like, notes, caramelly and with a sligthly roasty and bready note too. Full-bodiet and flat.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Pours muddy dark brown with absolutely no head. Very complex aroma with dark fruits like sour/bitter cherries, figs, dates, plums and some nice bourbon. Taste starts tart with the fruits mentioned and finishes slightly bitter and tart. Bourbon is present all the way. Long, pleasant aftertaste. Quite balanced considering all the ingredients. Body is pretty heavy with almost no carbonation. Overall this is an excellent beer. One of the best and most complex sour beers I ever had.

Sample from 375 ml. bottle. Dark amber colour with a thin, lightly tanned head. Fruity, sour aroma with tart fruits, cherries, yeasts - bretts, wood, rich caramel malts. Taste is sour. Full body with an oily texture and a flat carbonation. Finishes rather dry with tart fruits, spices and a vinous note. Well executed Sour.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 12.7oz bottle, no batch or bb date. Bold Object Randomly & Idiosyncratically Smuggled into a generous locals4locals trade box, danke! Dalí meets viticulture manual label, corked and caged. Pours flat and deep bordeaux. Condensed flemish Burgundy, RedBrown aroma: balsamico, cherry stone, milk chocolate, plum wine. Vinous in palate and barrel tannins: oak complements the almond of cherry stone, vanilla, raisin and Mon Chérie sweetness underneath. Drinks like a pinot noir or more bodacious-barreled Spätburgunder, with even less carbonation. Well-made quality US sour that obviously has been granted the luxury of time and patience to grow into a well-rounded sipper. worth a side-to-side tasting with several Rodenbach vintages.
Sample from Bottle - dark brown pour with thin beige head. Aroma and taste is sour fruity, mouth puckering palate, grassy, more sour fruits, interesting.

Bottle thanks to Jason for sharing. Dark brown pour with red highlights and a small foamy head that fades to a thin film. Aromas are red wine, vinegar, sour cherries, tobacco, and light alcohol. Tastes like sour cherry skins and vinegar. Light sourness. Light tartness in the finish. Some red wine in the finish too. Dont get any bourbon. Almost no booze either. Surprising that this is 11%. Good sour.
Dyp rødbrun uten skum. Cherry, kjeller og rødvinslukt. Smaker sure syrlige bær. Uten kullsyre. Lang snerpende ettersmak
Corked 37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma and flavour are vinegar, dried fruit, vanilla, brett, and wood - with a tart and slightly alcoholic finish.
Bottle shared by awesome peoples. Pours an pique dark brown with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma and taste of funk, tart, and all those delicious sour notes. Masks abv well.

Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Mørk rød, uklar farge, lite karbonert med en tynn skumtopp som forsvinner relativt raskt. Smaker eik, kirsebær, rødvin,sitrus kirsebærstein, bourbon og gjær. Behagelig syrlig. Rett og slett utsøkt

Color rojizo/caoba oscuro, sin espuma. Intenso aroma de frutos rojos, fresa y cereza, madera. cuerpo denso, sabor afrutado, cereza, acidez equilibrada y tostada con final seco y regusto largo e intenso. Excelente.
Real impressive! A funk up fruit and tart on the back make this really unique. A nice finish and not very carbinated. Great overall.
Bottle from SB. Pours no head. Cherrys and brett is noted in nose. Taste is like wine, very deep and a lot of flavours. A good beer, but not really my cup of tea.
Delicious, tart cherry flavor, even in the after taste. Very winelike. Aroma is bourban, cherry, caramelization. Thick and full bodied. Hint of warm vanilla and oak at the finish. So yummy.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Amber colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Fruit, alcohol, sour cherries.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, citrus, cherries, alcohol.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 flaska från Systembolaget. Wow det här är så maffigt. Stor koncentrerad doft av torkade syrliga körsbär, tranbär och russin. Stor kropp, madeira, portvin, stor syrlighet från körsbären, rejäl sötma och alkholvärme även om alkholen är väl integrerad en liten touch av fat. Perfekt balans och ren njutning. Riktigt riktigt gott.

Bottle, vintage 2012. Pours very dark brown with a reddish hue and as good as no head. Aroma is sweet cherries, bourbon barrels, tobacco and vanilla, as well as figs, raisins and red wine. 
Medium body with creamy texture and no carbonation. Flavour is tart with cherries and berries, prunes, as well as yeast, leather and oak. Dry earthy finish.

375ml bottle thanks to bytemesis! Pours oily dark brown with small thin head. Nose has some acetic acid, vinegar, booze, tart dark cherry, dark fruit. Taste is syrupy, slick, tart dark boozy fruits, light raisin, cherry, some vinous red grape, musty funk, sweet. Finish is tart acidic sweet dark fruit spice with a touch of sour burn. Complex.

a LONG time wish list item. lost abbey bottle and cork, not Port, but listed together here anyway. i was actually steeling myself to be slightly underwhelmed. the last couple LA sours were very good, but not quite great and in my little brain, this needed to be epic to justify its top 30 rank. upon opening the bottle and sniffing the cork, ALL worries went out the window. One of the best aromas of any beer ive ever had. after the amazing grace, which was more sour than expected, this was less, which id have thought a bad thing, but the slightly tart chocolate covered cherry and tobacco aroma was just amazing. the tartness comes through a little more in the flavor, but still a minor player. time may change that. pours a red/brown with no head, and the lack of carbonation is the only thing preventing this from getting a near perfect score. were hoping this develops some bubbles in the bottle, as a friend and I each have a bottle to sit on for a while...and Ive never looked forward to the aging of a beer as much as this one. EXCELLENT!!! 2012 - too bad. didnt age worth a crap. almost a drainpor. Hmmm..." from <3 as high as a 4.6-4.7. Awesome quality control, guys!! ;)

Bottle, via trade with haukur-- thanks! Nearly still medium brown, hazy, with brick red highlights. Malty with sour cherry and unripened berry character, lots of yogurty lactic acidity. Fairly full bodied, soft mouthfeel with very low carbo. Quite nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle, shared. Pours with no carbonation, no head. Murky, dark brick-red, sturdy alcohol legs. Very deep, complicated nose: tart cherry, raisin, caramel, tannin, vanilla, berry notes, balsamic. Decadent beer. Slick mouthfeel, finish sticks around. Big cherry mouthfeel, puckering start, dry ending. Weird and awesome.

-Backlog- Deep red with no head. Aroma is very vinous. Cherries, grapes, red fruit and some raisins. Full and fruity palate with no carbonation. Aftertaste is also full of fruit. Nice small sour bite in the end. Overall: Very interesting and vinous.

Tap at Toronado, Seattle. Pours a dark reddy brown with a light tan head. Sherry, cherry coke aroma. Medium body, medium carbonation. Dark choc, cherry, lemon, light dark fruit, lemon. Lovely balance, tart yet sweet, very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
All around good balanced brew with each and every flavor, sour and lemon sour and green apple sour but a good backbone of rich leathey and wood oak and pine tar. Medium carbonation. Loved this.

Bottle at home. Vintage 2012. Has a hazy, deep red brown colour with aproximately no head. Woody aroma with leather, berries, heather, brown sugar, cherries, creme brulee and cola. Has a sour flavour with more cherries, leather, oak and citric acid that lasts. Has a silky mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A pretty acidic and tasteful sour ale.

Cherry Coke appearance, minus the head. No visible head at all. Strong aroma of alcohol, bourbon, some tobacco and dark chocolate. Taste much of the same. No carbonation bothered me. Unique for a sour, but, as Ive found with many other @lostabbey beers, doesnt live up to the hype. Alcohol not well hidden, and very prominent on my palate. Disappointing Sour.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Dark brown murky beer with no head. Aroma has cherries, raisins and bourbon. Flavour is verry sour. Elements from aroma present too. Didnt hit my sweet spot although I usually like sourness and cherries. Maybe this wasva bit too much everything.-- rated with beerbasher / Lumia 1020

Aug Ale Alpharetta - Red/brown, muddy pour with minimal head. Taste is medium light tart, with lots of plum and raisin taste and forcefully finished off by the cherries and bourbon. Complex and tasty. Not overly sweet, but certainly sweet. The tart cherries and the Brett combine for a nice sour experience.

Aroma has a strong overtone of sour fruit and bourbon.bIt pours an opaque cola brown, not much of a head. Tart flavor has notes of cherry, bourbon, sour apple - and will make your face do calisthenics! Firm texture lacks fizz, but leaves a lasting sour fruit finish.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Brown, quite murky, no head. Smell of tart fruits, caramel, funk, hints of toast, oak and bourbon. Light sweet, cherries and booze, oak, vanilla, bourbon, raisins, some dark malts and toast. Extremely complex, medium sour, cherries, tart. Moderate bitter finish. A world class beer. Its complex and well balanced. Nice!

Pours murky brown with almost no fizz. Smells woody, sour, and of cherries. Taste is sour, cherry, hints of vanilla, and subtle wood notes. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Lost Abbey Cuvee de Tomme finishes with a lingering sourness reminiscent of cherries.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Reddish color, some foam. Aromas of cherry( quite distinct), nice yeast influence( Brett), autumn leaves , and some dried fruits. Some vanilla and bourbon in the finish. Medium body & high complexity . Superb sourness , some bitterness . Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours dark brown but with red notes, no head at all, small ring of foam along the side, some carbonation in the surface. Aroma is sweet vanilla and juicy raisins. Some burnt figs and brown sugar and wood., Tart notes of the sour cherries down under. Bit boozy. Taste is light sweet, mellow and then really sharp sour and tart. Not what one expectet and surprisingly medium body! Finish is really tart too and long lasting. But then too some vanilla. Nearly redwinish dry tounge. The barrel comes here. Really sour and the tartness makes a fresh dry beer out of dense big quod.

Couleur coca, pas de mousse. Nez très marqué vinaigre balsamique, aigre, légèrement vernis, vanille, raisins secs, cerises aigres, léger boisé. Bouche vraiment impressionnante, très aigre, encore bien plus quune Rodenbach Grand cru, peu de bulles, encore cerises aigres, raisins, bois, vanille, de lacidité aussi, noix, fruits rouges dans le fond, très sèche, presque tannique. Les 11% passent tout seuls. Longueur énorme sur le côté aigre de la cerise griotte.

16/VI/14 - 37.5cl bottle from Mi-Orge Mi-Houblon (Arlon) @ home - BB: n/a (2014-641) 
Clear dark purple brown beer, some big beige bubbles forming a cola-like head, unstable, dissipates immediately. Aroma: sourish, vinous, wood, bit oxidized, alcohol, fruity, sour berries, some chocolate, on warming up also vanilla notes and dried fruits.

750 ml bottle is 2005 vintage, courtesy of ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad! Pours a hazy dark brown with thin beige rim head. No lacing, but the viscosity of this beer provides legs. Aroma is sour cherries upfront, with yeasty spiciness, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Flavor is same with a port complexity and moderate sourness that is delicious. A real treat to have had this. From notes 1/23/10 (Geist Dark Lord tasting)

750 ml bottle of the 2009 vintage. Pours flat as a pancake. Great nose though. Lots of leather, dark caramel, and a hint of stone fruit in the nose. Full, complex flavor. Leather, port, dark bread, and a hint of sourness on the back end. Warming finish. Outstanding, but a little carbonation would do this brew wonders.

On draft at Capones Lost Abbey event. A sour-sweet, fruity brew with as much complexity as Ive ever come across. After trying this beer, I began having dreams about it (and about similar ones that so far exist only in my imagination). There is some lime in the aroma. The flavor is magnificently complex, with dashes of raspberry, cranberry, cider, lime, dark bread, and figs. It starts out tart, and then turns warm on the palate, before finishing with flavors of red wine and grains. Great!
Hazy brown with no head to speak of. Brown sugar , raisins , and cherry aromas. Flavor is mouth puckering tart. Sugar sweet with the brett making an appearance in the finish. Fruit lasts beyond.

Bottle pours very murky brown with chunky sediment, flat! Aroma is very rich sweet malts, bourbon, oak, dark fruits. Taste is very rich sweet booze and oak with some nice sour cherry and dark fruits. Too much going on here.

shared bottle with a friend, poured a murky brown colour with some red shades and flat as a pancake. caramel, malts, oak, vanilla, cherries, red grapes, booze, plums, tart, nice dry aftertaste, nice mouthfeel, nice brew! but its a bit to overpriced

12.7 oz bottle (2014) poured into a Belgian snifter. Pours dark brown with no head. Aromas of vinegar, dark fruit, bourbon, cherries. Tastes of dark fruit, cherries, vinegar, Brett, light oak. Medium body with a slightly warm and very dry finish. No carbonation.
At Avery Sour Fest 14. Dark brown like weak coffee. Nose of cherries, wet rotting wood, light cocoa. Taste follows, smooth and complex.

Let me start off by saying I'm not a huge sour fan. I try I really do and some day maybe I will be. But not yet. That being said, I can tell this is exceptionally done. Very compile beer. Tasted from draft. Pours very dark almost black with fine light tan bubbles. Good lacing, almost nitro looking. Aroma of dark fruits and bourbon. Lots of cherries with some prunes, figs and bourbon notes. Taste is very tart with dark fruits and bourbon flavors. I really want to like this beer but just haven't grown into the sours. If your a sour fan I'm sure you'll enjoy immensely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottleshare thanks to Beechner224. Aroma of cherry, raspberry, and lots of fruit roll up. Pours a flat ruby red, rather dark. Flavor is immediately puckering on the first sip. Second sip is still pretty tart but starts to show some of the fruitiness in the flavor. As I keep drinking the tartness subsides and the fruit comes through. Not getting any raisin flavor. Pretty good.
Bottle in trade. Pours a ruby brown, no head. Aroma is cherries first, then the sourness hits. Taste lots of cherry and tartness, mouth coating. The beer is pretty much flat, still yummy.
Bottle share thanks to beechner224. Pours a very deep red color, no head. Big funky, tart, sour, fruity, cherry. Very sour, sweet, lots of cherry, more tartness.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is vinous red fruits, wine like notes, malt, raisin, prunes. Flavour is medium sourness with loads of red fruits, a bit vinous, vinegar. Nice.
On tap at Capones. Pours dark reddish brown with tan head. Sour cherry, tea, chocolate, pear, tobacco. Layers of complexity. Quite sour and moderately sweet. Creamy, medium bodied.
Seven San a Diego Sours in Seven Days. #3 and quite possibly best beer ever. Raisins grapes tart acetic slight wine sourness. Rich oak background excellent!

Tap at hops and pie. Clear reddish brown with a tiny beige head. Aromas of bourbon, raisins, caramel, tart dark fruit and wood. Flavor is tart dark fruit, bourbon, caramel, plum, raisin and wood. Medium bodied, light vinegar and acidic.

Pours a dark brown, with copper/purple hues. Small off-white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is very vinous and acidic....rich tart cherry, raisin, brown sugar over a light roast and slight funk. Taste is very complex with loads of cherries upfront, but works quickly into a nice, oak and funk interplay. Vanilla, brown sugar and some roasted nuttiness provide some sweetness among the tart/sourness/funk of the yeast. Really nice barrel character gives hints of bourbon, port, sherry along with more dark fruit and leather. Finishes slightly oily and moderately tart and vinous. Really unique beer.

Bottle 2013 - brownish pour with sudsy head. Acetic nose with lots of fruit. Taste is heavy on sour cherries and some added sugar. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a dark cola with a tan head. Taste sour, cherries, a bit boozy but not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
No crown at all. Intense aroma of gelly candy, cola, cherry, and vanilla. The high ABV is present. Sour character, very fruity, unripe cherry taste with coca cola notes.
Lovely mellow sour beer. Has a tart aroma and complex flavor. Deep dark amber brown color. I can taste cherries but they don?t over power the beer.

Draft pour. Very dark with no head. Sour cherry aroma with a little funk. Dark fruit flavors with a really tart cherry flavor fading in to a nice, smooth fruit finish. Brown sugar flavor constant in this one. Extremely drinkable at 11%. A lot of flavor, and overall, a solid sour ale. Loved it.

Draft. Dark pour no head. Smell is a traditional red brown with some brown augar?/ caramel. Flavor is intensely tart. It is woody and balsamicy, sour cherry, funk that disaipates as you go. Harsh first sip but a nice beer.

Rerated 09.05.2014, 0,375l bottle (2012 vintage) @ home:
No head, just some bubbles, looks like mud water. Aroma is sweet fruity, sugar, thinner, paint, oak, sour red berries, grass, sorrel, hints of bourbon. Taste is sour-ish fruity, sorrel, red berries, oak, minerals, grass, raw rhubarb, berry skin, paint, sugar, caramel, grapes. Medium bitterness, nice acidic mouthfeel, alomst completely flat. Nice, but I also kind of expect more from this. Hopefully its kind of a "bad bottle", being completely flat and very muddy.

26.12.2012, 0,375l bottle (2009 vintage) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Sødmerik frisk fruktig lukt med preg av malt, sukker, maling, eplecidereddik, karamell, plastilin. Frisk syrlig smak med preg av malt, eplecidereddik, karamell, raude syrlige bær, syregras, litt maling. Middels bitterhet som set litt. God.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Bottle from Lost Abbey brewpub. Look is deep raspberry. Aroma is a bit of funk. Taste is sour, raspberries, raisins, soured (off) fruit. Finish is a lovely full and malty tang. Overall, a beautifully complex sour. Doesnt completely come together, but it is delicious and interesting. Whose complaining about a crazy sour when theres so much going on. Not a beer for relaxation.

Pours a coffee like body with no head or carboration. A rough aroma and a very sour taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.Deep reddish colour with no head.Aroma of sweet cherry and tart rotten berries,dry and coplex type of beer with dusty and even fruity finish overall not bad.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren, december 26th 2013 (as Abbey Cuvee de Tomme). Ruby brown body, thick beige head. Aroma of tart cherries, leather, raisins, oak. Taste is acidic with cherries, funk, pepper corns, and a sour fruity finish. Massve in taste, with a spicy cherry aftertaste. A top one!
On draft at Slsters 50/50 in Pasadena. Pours a cloudy cola brown with a thin tan head. Tart green pall nose. Flavors of raisin, prunes and sour cherry. Tart finish.

Dark, minimal tan head

Smell flemish, fruity, tart, diaper, 

Taste bandaid, tart fruity, 

Mid body

Ok

On tap at Falling Rock. Dark reddish brown appearance with a tan head. Aroma of raisins, sour cherries, funky yeast, candi sugar, oak, vanilla and dark fruits. Similar flavor, sour, tart, fruity and complex, there is a lot going on. Medium body, pretty easy and fun to drink. No sign of the 11% ABV. Loved it.

Poured from 12oz bottle from Blackwells. Sweet cherry sour and sangria aroma. No head at all on a dark reddish nearly black pour. Dry wine and wood earthy pepper taste. A lot going on. The style is growing on me

Deep red pour. 
Intense cherry blackberry aroma.
Flavor is similar, equally intense, and VERY tart. Amazing.
Uncarbonated. Virtually no head. Sour. Tart. Nuts. Chocolate. Complex. Quite sour. Brown. Nice beer

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 Bottle @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Clear dark mahogany, no head. Okay coating. Aroma, malty, sour, cherries, oak, light note of maple sirup, red berries. Taste, malty, raisin, plum, wine,  maple syrup, sour, cherries, red berries. Leaves a mouth feel similar to red wine.

On tap @ Beer Junction, listed as Lost Abbey here. Pours opaque reddish amber brown with thin cream colored head. Aroma is rich sweet dark caramel malt, notes of toffee and raisins; quickly overtaken by crisp tart sour cherries. Taste is likewise, with the sour notes coming on more quickly and aggressively. Prominent oaky barrel-aged notes on the finish. Sourness is restrained and rich rather than blisteringly tart. Abv is well hidden by the rich body, goes right under the radar. Amazing beer, I could drink this all night.

Bouteille de 375 ml. Arômes intenses de cerises sûres, de fruits secs et de bourbon. Robe brune aux reflets roux, effervescence faible et aucune mousse. En bouche, les cerises sûres sont à lavant-plan, mais on retrouve également de belles notes de raisins secs et une présence vineuse et liquoreuse provenant probablement du passage en fûts de chêne. Finale à la fois sucrée et maltée et très acide. Une bière intense et très agréable en petites quantités.

Shared 12.7 oz. bottle, poured to snifters showing a cloudy, mahogany color, with a light layer of bubbly, off white foam that reduced immediately to a thin ring & film, and light spots of lacing. The nose was tart & dry, with grape, dark cherry, and vinous notes. The taste exhibited more of an under control sourness, the aroma esters, plus additional hints of granny smith apple, minced meat, devoid of its sweetness, and some tannic astringency & dryness. Medium bodied, with no noticeable carbonation, rather hidden alcohol, but nicely complex and flavorful.

Bottle refuses to relinquish the cork from its grasp. Once open, let's out nary a pop. Pours deep plum, no head. Nose of arisen, cherries, wood, booze. Taste is modestly sweet at first with cherry juice, light tart sweeps in. Body is creamy but flat.
Draft. Dark Brown red pour with a thin white head. Nose is dark cherry rinds, funk, tart, hay. Taste is very tart cherry rind with lots of hay funk and a long red wine like finish.

Barwa: ciemna, głęboko rubinowa, pod światło przypominająca czerwone wino. Praktycznie bez piany, wysycenie zerowe. Sprawia wrażenie oleistości.

Aromat: owocowy, wiśniowy, kwaśny, alkoholowy, jakby drewniany. Bardzo ciekawy, zdecydowanie zyskujący z czasem.

Smak: kwaśny, wytrawny, alkoholowy, wręcz rozgrzewający i piekący w przełyku. Przypominający wino owocowe. Wyczuwalne akcenty drewniane.

Miałem duże oczekiwania w stosunku do Cuvee de Tomme, zwłaszcza że jest to chyba relatywnie najdroższe piwo jakie kupiłem (stosunek ceny do pojemności). Smakuje jak imperial kriek, dość dziki i kwaśny Leżakowanie w beczkach po burbonie z pewnością odcisnęło także swój wpływ. Jest to piwo do bardzo wolnego sączenia i delektowania się. Ocena została podwyższona z uwagi na złożoność tego piwa, ale stosunek ceny do jakości wypada bardzo, bardzo słabo. Z uwagi na to (jak i ograniczona dostępność) zapewne nie sięgnę po nie kolejny raz.

2013 Vintage corked and caged Lost Abbey bottle - Pours a murky reddish brown with not much head. Raisins and sour cherries for aroma. Very oaky, nice acidity, prunes and dark fruits, medium to thicker body, tasty.

Thx! to Kraddel. 375 ml. corked & caged LA bottle. Pours a very dark vinous red, blood red dark pomegranate with basically no head and no sign of carbonation. Smells very heavy of wood, cherries, cherry pits, lots of tem, sour, vinegar, cherry wood, touch nuts, Tart med. vinegar sour with oxidation notes manifesting as nuts, hazel, tart wood, lots of cherry, cherry pits, tart, lots of wood, very minor funk. Totally flat, acidic, vinegar, notes. Very nice but probably over-hyped at the same time (it is currently listed as #2 Sour Brown on RB) because it doesnt beat some far less expensive and rare beers within the style but that is the way these things work.

Bottle 
Pours dark red/brown , no foam 
Smell is acid , wood , honey . 

Little touch of carbo . Dry sour , wood , fleshy , cherries . Very dry sour ! 
Fleshy aftertaste , touch of cherrie and wood

Bottle. I cant believe I use to hate this style. Nice sour aroma and taste. Very complex witn notes of vino, dark fruit, wood, vanilla and cherry.
Very sour / tart finish. Amazing.
Bottle from my new buddy bytemesis - thanks man! Deep reddish cola pour with no head. Cherry and wood, hint of raisin, slight booziness, fairly dense on the tongue and also a bit lively. Delicious!

Very dark brown in color, no head. Nose of sour cherries. Taste of tart sour cherries, malty, boozy, raisins. Buttery mouthfeel. Finishes with a balanced sourness. Carbonation was a little dead in my bottle, but that was fine with me. Great tasting sour, would love another one!
Pour is dark red/brown with no head. Very low carbonation. Aroma and flavor of sour fruit, raisins, oak, and cherries. Sugar and tartness in the finish.

08/02/2014 Bottle shared @ Ma che Siete Venuti a fà (thanks Manuele Colonna!). Ambrata carica vermiglia, con riflessi rubino, schiuma biancastra media. Naso impressionante per intensità, molto legno, frutta rossa, vinosa, alcol ben nascosto. In bocca è acida decisa, intensa e lunghissima, ancora note di frutta rossa, vinosa, ancora legno, una nota acetica caratterizzante. Corpo medio, grande intensità e carattere. Una signora birra!

12.7 oz corked and caged bottle, labeled as Lost Abbey Cuvee de Tomme; labeled as 11.0% ABV. Aroma consists of wood, vinegar, Band-Aid, funk, overripe dark fruit, raisins. Pours a headless dark brown with a thin beige collar of foam. Taste is extremely sour (10/10 on a sour scale), acidic, savory, lots of dark fruit mingling with woody notes; finishes with a tannic dryness. Carbonation is fairly soft but its a lot more there than the unblended lambic I had before this. Awesome!
Beautiful sweet bubblegum and tart cherry aromas. Pours a blood red. Sour wine, vinegar flavors. Effervescent. Nice.
Fresh on tap. Delicious. Not an aggressively tarty sour. Great fruity flavor and a pronounced funk.

12.7 oz bottle- Pours a very dark red with no head but some carbonation bubbles floating to the surface. Aroma is tart cherries, funk, wood, pie crust. The taste is cherry filling, moderately tart, wood. This is extremely delicious but to say its unlike anything else I think is a little misleading.

On tap for Sacramento beer week. Ive been hunting down sours and finally nailed one. Aroma is sour but has some red malt aroma as well. Flavor is moderately sour with a nice sweet sour malt finish. This is great!

2012 B Vintage bottle at home. Very dark brown with no head. I tried to create a head but nothing! Sweet fruity, cherry aroma, with wood, some vanilla I think and definitely chocolate. Very nice! Because of this nice and quite complex aroma I didn't expect the sour punch at my tongue! Very sour at the beginning. Vinegar and cherries and some citrus fruits (lemon). This sourness makes you think that there is a lot of carbonation (but there isn't). After this sour punch there is some oaky malty vanilla sense which disappears in a sour cherry finish.

Bottle pours dark reddish-brown with almost no head. Wonderful aroma of sour cherries. Taste cherries, vinous, slight oak, funk, dark fruits, slight malts. Finish prolonged cherries and tartness, slightly dry. Palate full with slight alcohol burn. I didnt pick up any bourbon other than a suggestion of sweetness. Im not a big sours fan but this is well done.

Had on tap at Crush and Brew. $7.50 for the 8oz. To short-stemmed tulip, it pours a crimson-tinted mahogany with which a thin, bubbly off-white ringed head barely even a pinky nail in length stood. Aromas of maraschino cherries, cough syrup, blueberry leaves, marshmallow root, black licorice candies, booze, and Belgian yeast. Tastes the same with the addition of sweet and sour sauce, banana peppers, and limeade. Another hyped "meh" sour. Far too much going on. Vinegary and spicy. Not bad, but definitely doesnt live up to the legend.

11%. 12.7oz. Pours a murky caramel with no head and slight, cloudy sediments. Lighter than the base beer. Aroma has huge bourbon barrel notes with sour cherries and a hint of vanilla. Really fricking good. Taste is a medium sour with sour cherries and subtle notes of the bourbon barrels. Medium body and carbonation with a big dry finish. Slight alcohol warmth. Overall very nice. Sours arent my favorite style but still nice. Good drinkablity. Well worth trying.
On draft at Churchills! Near perfect beer! Absolute perfection in a glass! Loads of sour cherries all over!

Pours a dark brown/black with thin, quickly dissipating white head. Aroma of oak, cherries, dates, and must. Taste is quite tart with sour cherry, raisin, currant, and finishes with oak. Mouthfeel is thin. Overall decent our but didn't live up to the hype for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: very deep brown, light haze with no head or lace. Sour, Brett, roasted malt, cooked citrus rind and a little burnt. Chemical and a little funky. Dry, sour, phenolic and bitter. Huge citrus rind edge. Long and tight. Loads of flavor. It is mousey. 
Too hard and dirty for me. Certainly wild and sour.

Lost Abbey bottling. Just outstanding! Starts almost like a red wine, acid up front, nice oak character. Dark fruit, brown sugar aroma. Very low carbonation level but it works. Very complex and enjoyable.

13.02.2014. Bottle labeled The Lost Abbey Cuvee de Tomme kindly shared by abemorsten. At Schouskjelleren, Oslo. Dark brown colour with no head. Aroma is very sour..! Its so sour it bites my tounge. Tastes a lot, but its well hidden behind all of the sourness. Notes of berries and fruit. There is also some faint malts. Mostly very fresh and sour!

Draft. So amazing! Perfect balance. Pours cola with ruby hues. Cherry must, tart funk, just the right amount of sour, a bit sweet. Very complex. Love this. So glad I got to try it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared 375 ml bottle at Schouskjelleren as Lost Abbey Cuvee DeTomme. Clear deep ruby colored body. No head. Caramel, prunes, vanilla, toffee, raisins, barrel notes, vinuous tones and more in the complex aromas of this beer. This is one of those beers where sniffing the glass is tremendously rewarding. Fruity acids and malts in the mouth. Very rich and complex but still a well balanced impression. Medium to full bodied. Another killer beer from these masters.

Draft. Dark red with a thin tan head. Aroma is sour cherry and musty funk. Taste follows suit and adds some vinegar notes with an excellent sweet oak finish. Medium sticky mouthfeel and light carbonation. Unbelievably good.

Bottle shared at Ma Che, Trastavere - big thanks to Manuele, 08/02/14 as Lost Abbey Cuvee De Tomme.
Opaque mahogony brown with a beige head that clears to a pond.
Nose is dank wood, earthy, bitter pitted fruits, damp damp wood personified, tangy berry fruits, tarte red grape skins, touch of dry rot.
Taste comprises fruit balsams, light acidic notes, dark pitted fruits, tarte cherries, light spice, splash of vinegar, dank wood.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, light acid burn in a drying finale.
Solid stuff, deserves its place near the top of the style tree !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap..Pour is dark brown with a thin tan head..Nose is nice berries, cherries, spice, some vinegar...Taste is nice cherries, berries, tart, oak, cherry pie, small balsamic vinegar..
On tap at Beercraft. Pours a dark reddy brown color without much head. Wonderful medium level sourness with noticeable toffee background and nice sweetness to balance the sour.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2015 Jesus, Mary, and Joseph. OK, where to start? The pour is a flat, uneven, cloudy sort of walnut-colored liquid with only a few tiny bubbles forming on the sides of the glass. The nose is as baffling as it is unforgettable. Based on a purely verbal dissection, it sounds like a garbage can, but seriously, put it all together and you get one of the best aromas youll ever come across. The first notes are salty and sour: balsamic vinegar, mushroom sauce, and lime juice. Then come, of course, cherries, in addition to red wine, oak, caramelized sugar, chocolate-covered raisins, apple cider, overripe fruits, and booze. Take a sip, and youll get sour, sweet, and salty -- in that order of preeminence. The mouthfeel is flat, with a medium body and no carbonation. Your lips become sticky after a while and your teeth very much feel the acidity. Call me crazy, but Id love to pour a bit of this on the pan after having seared a couple of nice filet mignons. Throw in some mushrooms, and youve got a nice steak dinner going. Then again, Im absolutely not wasting a single drop of this on anything other than drinking it myself.
Had the Lost Abbey-version. Very good indeed. Sour with notes from oak, cherries, apples, vanilla and nuts.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Having at a Lost Abbey dinner at Monks in Feb 2014. Thick cloudy cherry brown with a ring of tan foam. Black cherry cordials. Thick dark red fruit. Chocolate pudding. Leather wallet. Pecans. Unfiltered, unpolished cherry malt brew. Wonderful! Great dark sour. UPDATE: Having again after the same Monks dinner a year later. The 2015 version feels dryer. A full tart fruit sour balanced with tremendous dark malts. Stronger spicy tannins this time. Black pepper. Even more complex. Unexpected nice brightness to it. Should age wonderfully!

375 ml bottle 2009 (also draft). Pours a hazy ruby brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have tart black cherry, sweet caramel and toffee, oak, Brett, some acidity but a bit dry at the finish. I liked the sweet sour combination and the subtle notes created by the different Brett strains and oak barrel.

Bottle @ Too many geuzes only one toilet, Ulfborg 2012. Unclear reddish brown of color with a beige head. Ab aroma of raisins, vinegar, liqurice, sweets, oak cherries and weak sour. A flavor of figs, raisins, sour, alcohol, oak and vinegar.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2014 Bottle. Pours cloudy reddish brown with no head. Aroma is tart cherries, oak, bourbon, figs, raisins, vinous. Taste is light sweet dried fruits up front, tart cherries and vinous notes then takes over. Alcohol is very well hidden.

Took me 5 minutes getting the cork out. Opens without a pop. Pours real flat with no head whatsoever, color is murky brown. Very limited amount of carbonation. Aroma is vinegar, overripe fruit and red berries. Very vinous taste with again vinegar, sour cherries, vanilla, almonds and currants. Good one!

Intressant Ale. De sura körsbären får den att påminna om en lambic. Tyvärr tycker jag att "surheten" tar överhanden och man missar den mörka alen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 375ml corked bottle, poured into a Duvel tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy dark brown with non existent head, just a few bubbles that quickly dissipated. Aroma of plums, table grapes, overripe apples, cherries and a noticeable oak wood character. Taste is light sweet and bitter, significant sourness. Palate is full bodied with a slightly sticky texture, soft carbonation. I rarely like sour beers, but this is an exception, excellent for the style. The striking sourness is well paired with the high ABV, also the oak wood notes really work well with the flavours.

After no pop when the cork was removed, the beer pours a murky reddish-brown color with a minimal off-white head that dissipates quickly. Spotty lacing. Aroma of tart fruit, malt and oak. Full-bodied, somewhat flat and syrupy with flavors of sour cherries, vinous oak and subtle buttery bourbon. The finish is oaky with a black cherry aftertaste. Above average, but would have been stellar if it wasnt so flat.
Bottle. Reddish brown colour with almost no head. Red wine, sour fruit, oak, vanilla, bourbon. Sour, tart finish. Almost no carbonation. Warming alcohol.
